alert.note: Alert for Ontonagon (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 8:30AM EDT by NWS Marquette
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Ontonagon County through 900 AM EDT... At 828 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles northeast of Mass City to near Bruce Crossing. Movement was southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Pea size hail, torrential rainfall, and frequent lightning. SOURCE...Radar indicated rainfall amounts of one to four inches have already occurred. IMPACT...Ponding water is possible on area roadways and other poorly drained locations. Locations impacted include... Mass City. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
